cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles (415 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the north-western Caribbean, crossing the NE Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night and then moving over the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast (LA/TX) Sunday–Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast, most likely the Louisiana-Texas border vicinity
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system remains inland after landfall near the port’s coast)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Punta Herrero to Cancun (eastern Yucatan)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Punta Herrero to Dzilam (eastern–northern Yucatan)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Yucatan Peninsula this weekend; north-western Gulf Coast including Louisiana and Texas early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (along lower Mississippi River and adjacent coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible late Monday night through Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible at Mississippi River mouth and adjacent bays
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could produce 4–8 inches with localized higher totals causing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated river levels, rough inland waterways, dangerous lightning, and port operational disruptions due to prolonged rainfall and gusty squalls
